document.text:
From: Christian Everdell  
To:' 
Cc: 
obbi C. Sternheim, Esq." 
Laura Menninger Jeff Pagliuca 
Subject: [EXTERNAL] RE: Stip 
Date: 
Sun, 21 Nov 2021 04:20:07 +0000 
Attachments: Stipulatio Trial Testimony.PDF 
Attached is a clean version of the stip. The only thing I changed from the version you last saw is that we now label the stip 
Defendant's Trial Exhibit A. 
You can email me the signed version and hand deliver it to me at the conference on Tuesday, whichever works best for 
you. 
Thanks, 
Chris 
From: 
Sent: Saturday, November 20, 2021 2:37 PM 
To: Christian Everdell 
Cc 
C 
;Jeff Pagliuca 
Subject: RE: Stip 
Hey Chris, 
This works for us. If you send me a clean version, I'll sign and return it to you, or I can just sign it at the conference 
Tuesday. 
Thanks, 
•  Bobbi C. Sternheim, Esq.<II>; Laura Menninger 
From: Christian Everdell < 
Sent: Friday, November 19, 2021 9:04 PM 
To: 
Cc 
>; 
Jeff Pagliuca 
Subject: [EXTERNAL] RE: Stip 
Bobbi C. 
Sternheim, 
Esq. ; Laura Menninger 
Following-up on our conversation today, is the revised stipulation acceptable to the government? 
EFTA00014683

From: I 
Sent: Tuesday, November 16, 2021 7:03 PM 
To: Christian Everdell < 
Cc: 
; 
Bobbi C. Sternheim, 
Esq. < 
; 
Laura 
Menninger 
>; Jeff Pagliuca 
Subject: Stip 
Hey Chris, 
Following up on our conversation today regarding the stip, would you agree to have the sentence say that the document is 
a "true and accurate copy of the transcript of one witness's trial testimony, but not the full trial transcript, given on 
February 26 . . . ."? If so, we are fine with the stip — and, of course, happy to consider other language that makes the same 
point. 
Thanks, 
Assistant United States Attorney 
Southern District of New York 
EFTA00014684
